What is the expected result? the results gets cleared within a few seconds and then leaves a note "Console was cleared"
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: MyGoogleUI is closed but _dismissAccountDetailsViewController is still not run
entry.content:
The crash repro steps: 1- Sign in with an account 2- Open account settings -> Manage accounts on this device 3- Choose any account and choose to view "My Google UI" from the alert menu 4- Close "My Google UI" using the "X" button, it should go back to the "Accounts on this device" settings page 5- Sign out using the "Sign out" button on current page; "Accounts on this device" settings page
Current state: Crash at DCHECK(self.presentedViewController), as the _dismissAccountDetailsViewController is not null, and it'll run, but the view is dismissed when "X" button was clicked so there is no presentedViewController.

entry.title: Move index and pinned_state_change to the relevant WebStateListChange subclasses
wl_pointer.enter must never be ignored
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open chromium under KDE with ozone=wayland 2. Open two tabs and detach one so that there are two windows 3. Select some text in the first window and drag it into the tab bar of the second window. This should open a new tab with a google search for the selected text. 4. WIthout moving the cursor out of the second window, scroll in the tab that was just created. 5. The first window is scrolled instead. Similarly, all button events are processed by the first window.
# Problem Description Chromium ignores wl_pointer.enter events if a DnD operation is in progress:
``` if (self->connection_->IsDragInProgress()) { VLOG(1) << "Ignoring enter event received during dnd session."; return; } ```
However, this is never correct because this will cause subsequent pointer events (scrolling, movement, buttons, etc.) to handled as if they were sent to the previous window.
# Summary wl_pointer.enter must never be ignored
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: DevTools lags after update
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 OS : Win10 Pro x64 22H2 19045.2251
What steps will reproduce the problem? -I don't know. I just had a problem after auto-updating.
What is the expected result? -I have a good PC Ryzen 7 5800x, 32 GB RAM, GTX 3070Ti, DevTools worked fine for a year and a half, then half a year ago after an auto update, suddenly DevTools started to lag, I noticed right away, I rolled back the PC and turned off auto updates in Chrome, and everything again worked well. About two weeks ago Chrome was updated and I did not immediately notice the problem, because the problem did not appear immediately but accumulated, after 5-10 minutes of work lags began. I didnâ€™t roll back, I thought there would be an update that would fix it. Today I updated Google Chrome myself by going to the about menu. And the problem still remains. Of course, I tried all the standard methods, cleared the cache and tried different options to enable/disable in the settings after reading on the Internet what could help, but nothing helped. DevTools need to work properly.
What happens instead? -After 5-10 minutes of work, DevTools starts to slow down a lot, the console starts to slow down, the game opened in the browser starts to slow down.

entry.title: Update call sites of partitioned cookies constructors to no longer rely on default values
entry.content: Adding the ancestor chain bit to partitioned cookies has required the constructors to change . Update all the call sites of the non-test constructors to no longer rely on default values.

entry.title: Tests are failing: privacy_sandbox_dialog_view_browsertest.cc(115): Actual function call count doesn't match EXPECT_CALL(*mock_service(), PromptActionOccurred(Privacy...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): privacy_sandbox_dialog_view_browsertest.cc(115): Actual function call count doesn't match EXPECT_CALL(*mock_service(), PromptActionOccurred(PrivacySandboxService::PromptAction::kNoticeShown))...\n Expected: to be called once\n Actual: never called - unsatisfied and active
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PrivacySandboxDialogViewBrowserTest.InvokeUi_Notice
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/d3da02ef823f4984a2980b51d0b1a71b
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Refactor MoveWebStateAtImpl with a MoveWebStateAtInternal
gn.exe failed to generate Visual Studio sln.
entry.content:
There're some rust dependencies that cause gn.exe failed to generate with `--ide=vs` because the name of the file is too long.
I've already fixed this problem in gn: https://gn-review.googlesource.com/c/gn/+/16600
But the problem persist unless `buildtools/win/gn.exe` is replaced with new gn.exe I'm not familiar who will pull the binary from where.
I find Skia will download and copy to that place: (third_party/skia/bin/fetch-gn) ``` # We'll also copy to a path that depot_tools' GN wrapper will expect to find the binary. copy_path = 'buildtools/linux64/gn' if 'linux' in sys.platform else \ 'buildtools/mac/gn' if 'darwin' in sys.platform else \ 'buildtools/win/gn.exe' if os.path.isdir(os.path.dirname(copy_path)): shutil.copy(gn, copy_path) ```
The readme says the binary will be pulled by `gclient sync`.
Could anyone update the gn with this fix?

entry.title: Add tests to check that the correct notifications are sent for each scenario
The Profile Icon in the NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly
entry.content:
Chrome Version :123.0.6302.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: M121 Rollout) Revision :f7b500ca3431d37194eccdec5138601a342f0489-refs/branch-heads/6302@{#1}
OS: Win(10,11)
Pre Conditions: Login Successfully
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Login Successfully. 2. Open NTP and Observe the Profile Icon. 3. The Profile Icon in NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly.
Actual Result : The Profile Icon in the NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly.
Expected Result : The Profile Icon in NTP page should not break and it should look Clearly.
This Issue is exists from M-113 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ClK3I0STTByxUJEIX5GggBklu7rB4eOs/view?usp=sharing https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bx8atBAIiwYg3GKJEcIW4P6CZtCe9kR_/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. This issue is able to repro on Stable #122.0.6261.39, Beta #122.0.6261.39 and Dev #123.0.6286.0 2. This issue is repro in Today's Dev RC #123.0.6300.3
Thank You...!!

header
row 1
row 2
row 3
# Problem Description Vertical align should be preserved. It used to work in Chrome 84. # Additional Comments See row 3 with wrong align. # Summary TD with vertical align middle is rendered as top align when the cell splits over a page # Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below #### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself #### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem # Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Add old_group/new_group fields to WebStateListStatus
Add Tab Groups support to the new serialization code
[Chrome iOS] Gamepad API does not work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Connect a gamepad to an iOS device (in my case I used bluetooth to pair the controller to the device) 2. In the Safari browser on iOS, visit https://hardwaretester.com/gamepad. Press some buttons on the gamepad. 2. In Chrome on iOS, visit https://hardwaretester.com/gamepad. Press some buttons on the gamepad.
# Problem Description Observed result:
In the Safari browser, it successfully detects the gamepad and its input. In Chrome on iOS no gamepad input is ever detected.
Expected result:
Chrome on iOS to also be able to detect gamepad input.
# Additional Comments I originally discovered this issue and assumed it was a WKWebView bug and filed it with Apple here: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=269292
Apple's response was: "To expose Gamepad support, your WKWebView needs to be the firstResponder."
So it may be the case that Chrome for iOS needs to configure its WKWebView to allow gamepad input to work.
# Summary [Chrome iOS] Gamepad API does not work
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>GamepadAPI
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: OOPIF PDF: Embedded PDF does not load with data URL
entry.content:
Repro Steps:
1. Open Chrome with flag PdfOopif
